result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Martinez

defendant.name: Martinez, Michael A
defendant.address: 2712 South Chicago Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Allison Ritter informed the Court via phone that she is currently in trial and requests adjournment. Court grants request. Defendant Michael A Martinez appeared in Court and was provided a next court date slip. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael A Martinez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defendant advises the Court that he has retained Attorney Allison Ritter but due to medical issues, she could not appear today. The Court was made aware counsel previously contacted the Court and received a new date off the record. Defendant advised of the new date as well as the rotation. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Martinez in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.
Defendant rejected representation from public defender office. Indigency Hearing held. 
Defendant in process of retaining private counsel.
Court advised defendant to retrain private counsel by the next court date or provide proof of reapplying for public defender representation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Martinez in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael A Martinez appeared by video means.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Court ordered case adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
  Indigency hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Michael A Martinez in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant Declined Public Defender representation will be retaing private counsel. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of 13 RESERVE JUDGES in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-17-2022 @1p
